item.description:
EVENT: Join us on a bus and walking tour celebration of nearly two centuries of Boston's Jewish history explored through known and forgotten synagogues and neighborhoods of Boston's oldest congregations.  We will explore current synagogues, and former sanctuaries that are now churches or public buildings downtown, in the Back Bay, Roxbury, and Brookline, and we will visit Boston's oldest Jewish cemetery in East Boston. This bus tour is a special tribute to Temple Ohabei Shalom (TOS) on its 170th anniversary.  Tour led by Ellen Smith, historian and curator of Boston Jewish history; Associate Professor, Dept. of Near Eastern and Judaic Studies and Director, Hornstein Jewish Professional Leadership Program, Brandeis University.
RSVP: Advanced registration is required.  "RSVP to" address TBD (this info will be provided later in the month)
MEET: We will meet at TOS, 1187 Beacon Street, Brookline, at 12:15 and leave promptly at 12:30 - 6:15 -- rain or shine.
COST: $40 per person.  Since this event is organized by Temple Shalom of Milton, there will not be an additional $5 non-member charge for non-Mosaic guests.
item.how_to_find_us: Advanced registration is required. "RSVP to" address TBD (this info will be provided later in the month)

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Bus and Walking Tour of Boston's Jewish History
